Message.Title: Question: What causes poverty in modern society?
Message.Msg: Opinion: Statistically you are very unlikely to be poor if you: a) Graduate from high school b) Get a job -- any job c) Get married and have children -- in that order. Poverty is largely a function of the failure to do one or more of these things.

Topic.Title: Reagan created 2 Million Jobs in One Month - Fact

Message.Msg: Twenty-two million jobs were created during the Clinton administration. Job creation data for each president since 1960, courtesy Wikipedia: Kennedy-Johnson Administration: 5.9 million LBJ administration: 9.9 million Nixon's first term: 6.2 million Nixon-Ford administration: 5.1 million Carter administration: 10.3 million Reagan administration (both terms): 16.1 million Bush 41 administration: 2.6 million Clinton administration (both terms): 22.7 million Bush 43 administration: 1.95 million Or put another way: From 1980 to the end of the Bush 43 administration, all three Republican presidents combined produced, over a period of 20 years, two million fewer jobs than Bill Clinton managed to eke out in eight. Kennedy and Johnson managed to produce 50 percent more jobs in four years than the Bushes did in twelve. (In Bush 43's first term he produced ten thousand jobs.) And as for Carter...the Republicans portray him as a president who could do nothing right, but in his four years he managed to produce nearly as many jobs as Reagan did in his second term--10.3m for Carter, 10.8m for Reagan.

Message.Title: BAC $18 by August 2013 - Here is why
Message.Msg: I have been away from this Board for months, however, nothing has changed. A bunch losers have hijacked this board to post nonsense and garbage. I wish there was a board that discussed financials nothing else. BAC will be $18 by August. I have bought tons of calls. Everything is coming into place. Like all the stars all lining-up and it will be explosive. Obama wants to do the "big deal" according to: :“What I see from the president is probably the most encouraging engagement on a big issue that I’ve seen since the early years of his presidency,” Senator Lindsey Graham, a South Carolina Republican, said yesterday after a 10-minute phone call with Obama. “He wants to do the big deal.” #$%$ Europe. Everyone has had it with them. Italy, Spain, this and that. They can go #$%$ themselves. Italy will form a government and there will be no need for reelections there. The economy is picking up like hell. According to the news today. Finally, the "stress test" will be over tomorrow and Fed will announce how much more dividend BAC can payout or even stock buy backs. This baby is going to $18 by August. We also have two more earnings reports by then.

Message.Msg: He has, and you're right. He's made them dependent. He's given them so much money that the money is nearly worthless through inflation from his rapidly expanding currency supply policy with no corresponding external demand. They want more, and he promised more. More of the same. Note that the poor are still poor and are still unable to sustain themselves. That's how he helped them. He made them slaves and voters, nothing more. They are no longer human in the traditional sense. They are now leeches. Without him and his destructive monetary policy, they will not survive. If he had lived, the result would have been the same. They are doomed, and you are emotional without common sense. If we make all the poor millionaires, a million dollars will buy a cup of coffee. Maybe. But not at Starbucks.

Topic.Title: Reagan created 2 Million Jobs in One Month - Fact

Message.Msg: You and Siri are sooo funny. You can take credit for Kennedy, LBJ and Carter - all had congress in their pocket, so the credit rightly goes to the party. Reagan gets credit for his job creation because he fought the will of a Democrat congress and won. Bush Sr fought a democrat congress and lost, so they get part credit fror his dismal jobs and the recession. Clinton does not get full credit because he fought the will of a Republican congress and lost. The congress drove him far to the right, and that's what created the jobs, and everybody except the useful idiots acknowledges that. Likewise, W Bush was driven to the left. If you took out the last year of his administration with Dems running their failed policies at full tilt, the jobs number under W with republicans running congress was several million higher. And you left out Obama. He's lost something like 3 or 4 million so far. But he's not done yet, and my forecast is that he will lose as many jobs as were created during Clinton 2nd term, but he may throw a few million more under the bus. Right now, Obama is the all-time loser on job creation. And the unemployed idiot slaves adore him.

Message.Title: Oliver Stone, Sean Penn hail ''hero' Chavez
Message.Msg: US filmmaker and long-time Hugo Chavez supporter Oliver Stone hailed the late Venezuelan leader as a "great hero" on Tuesday, saying he will "live forever in history." Actor and activist Sean Penn, another Hollywood friend to Chavez, also paid tribute saying the world's poor had lost a "champion" and America had also lost "a friend it never knew it had." "JFK" and "Natural Born Killers" director Stone said: "I mourn a great hero to the majority of his people and those who struggle throughout the world for a place.

Message.Msg: Unlike so many South American leaders over the years (that the US either actively supported or downright installed) he didn't steal billions, he didn't murder the masses...indeed he aided and improved the lives of the poorest - and there were many - with basic necessities. And, as you say, he was able to hiold at arm's length the voracious and implacable vulture and carpetbagger capitalists with relative ease and humor. A Venezuelan nationalist, patriot and humanist, it seems to me. If the world had more like him it would be a better place.
